title: Amazing Rice Planting Technique That Will Blow Your Mind! #shorts #agricultural #farmer #technique

subtasks: Positioning feed sacks near the machinery entrance.
Unfurling feed from the sack into the hopper.
Checking the load level to prevent overflow.
Closing the machinery feed door securely after filling.
Identifying the correct nozzle for the sprinkler.
Attaching the nozzle to the sprinkler hose.
Adjusting the nozzle to desired spray pattern.
Ensuring secure connection of the sprinkler to the water source.
Manually moving the pivot point to assess rotation.
Checking for obstacles that might impede rotation.
Lubricating the pivot joint if needed.
Identifying the PVC pipe connections to be modified.
Cutting the pipe with appropriate tools.
Measuring and marking the new pipe length.
Aligning the pipe ends for a proper fit.
Applying sealant or glue to the PVC joints.
Ascending a ladder or platform.
Securely positioning on a higher level of a barn or structure.

tasks.task: Inserting PVC pipe into a wall.
subtasks: Locating the structural wall opening.
Aligning the PVC pipe with the opening.
Inserting the pipe through the wall opening carefully.
Ensuring the pipe is straight and properly positioned.
Joining two PVC pipes end-to-end.
Applying adhesive to the pipe ends.
Pressing the pipes together until fully bonded.
Attaching a sprinkler head to the irrigation pipe.
Ensuring the sprinkler is directed towards the crops.
Securing the connection with clamps or compression fittings.
Pushing or pulling the sprinkler pipe from the source to the field.
Realigning the pipe if necessary.
Identifying the leaking sprinkler head.
Disconnecting the faulty sprinkler.
Cleaning or replacing the nozzle or seal.
Attaching the trailer to the tractor.
Loading the trailer with feed sacks.
Detaching the trailer and driving to the field.
Placing the main irrigation line along the field edge.
Hammering stakes into the ground for proper positioning.
Securing the mainline to the stakes.
Cutting the appropriate length of irrigation tape.
Attaching the tape to the main irrigation line.
Ensuring proper connections and no leaks.
Unrolling hay or feed into the cow pen.
Distributing the feed evenly among the cows.
Cleaning the feeding area.
Approaching the gate from the tractor.
Unfolding the gate if needed (e.g., a roll-up gate).
Aligning the gate with the opening.
Locking the gate properly to secure entry.
Adjusting the position of a PVC pipe segment.
Marking the alignment for cutting.
Stretching the irrigation tape across the field.
Securing the tape to the ground with clips or staples.
Tensioning the tape to minimize sagging.
Determining the fuel level in the equipment.
Locating the fueling port or nozzle.
Measuring the fuel volume poured.
Inspecting all gates in the farmyard for proper functioning.
Lubricating hinges or moving parts.
Verifying the structural integrity of farm structures.
Tightening loose bolts or screws.
